translation: This is the so-called Yuetian sanmei jing, a scripture of the two collections of Buddhist texts of the local and Song dynasties called Yuetian sanmei jing (i.e., the Lotus Sutra), which was translated by Emperor Xian earlier but whose syllables and meanings were quite different from those of the Sanzang jing

source_sentence: 未知孰是。
translation: We don't know who it is.

source_sentence: 按《開元錄》先公譯本目下注云：「一名『文殊師利菩薩十事行經』」，
translation: According to the commentary under the title of the first translation of the Kaiyuan lu, it's said, One is called Mañjuśrī Bodhisattva's Ten Practices Sutra.

source_sentence: 又指多小云「一十紙」。
translation: It also refers to the many lesser sayings, One ten sheets.

source_sentence: 今檢之，彼丹藏經乃是矣。
translation: Now, when we examine it, we'll see that this is the Danzang jing.

source_sentence: 此鄉宋藏經始從三界乃至道識——凡歷九十餘法——皆以六行說之，曾無十事之言。
translation: From the beginning of the Song store scriptures in this country, from the three realms up to the path and consciousness - more than ninety teachings - are all explained in six lines, and there's never been a statement of ten things.

source_sentence: 又其多小，是古之二十紙，則知非先公譯明矣。
translation: Moreover, many of them are small and these are the ancient twenty fascicles, so we know that they weren't translated by the late emperor.

source_sentence: 今恐宋藏失先公之譯，而得古所失安世高譯、無譯主之名者，見目錄中有月燈經名，
translation: Now I fear that the Song dynasty may have lost the translation of the ancient Sanskrit text translated by Emperor An Shigao, and there is no title for a master who translated it. See the names of the moonlight scriptures found in the Catalogue.

source_sentence: 是先公譯者，乃錯題其名耳。
translation: This is a translation by the late gong, who incorrectly titled it by its own name.

source_sentence: 又錄云：「出大經第七卷」，今撿似出第五卷之後半，猶未適當何也，
translation: Again, the record says, “The seventh fascicle of the Mahayana scripture appears in the second half of the fifth fascicle. What do you think it is?
